intro: Cyanea bondiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cyanea bondiana is an important species in Hawaiian flora and is often found in coastal habitats where it contributes to the local ecosystem.
